text: Baeturia, Beturia, or Turdetania was a region in the southern part of the Iberian Peninsula (in modern Spain) between the Guadiana and the Guadalquivir rivers. In the Iron Age, it was inhabited by Celts and the Turdetani. The territory was conquered by the Roman Empire in the 2nd century BCE. ==See also== * Turdetani * Hispania Baetica Category:Geography of Spain
title: Baeturia, Spain
